title: What does the FIA president actually do?
summary: What exactly are the duties of the FIA president as the head of the ruling body, and how is he elected? All your questions answered

qa_pairs.question: What is one of the primary responsibilities of the FIA president in Formula 1?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: To oversee the regulation and governance of motorsport activities.
wrong_options: To make race strategy decisions for teams.

qa_pairs.question: How is the FIA president elected?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: Through a vote by the member clubs of the FIA.
wrong_options: By a popular vote from F1 fans.
By appointment from the Formula 1 teams.
By the previous FIA president's nomination.

qa_pairs.question: Which of the following is NOT a role of the FIA president?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: Competing as a driver in Formula 1 races.
wrong_options: Setting the rules for Formula 1 races.
Representing the FIA in international motorsport discussions.
